text: Thryptomene striata is a shrub species in the family Myrtaceae that is endemic to Western Australia. The erect and compact shrub typically grows to a height of . It blooms in September producing pink-purple flowers. It is found in the Mid West region of Western Australia between Geraldton and Northampton where it grows in sandy to loamy soils with ironstone. ==References== striata Category:Endemic flora of Western Australia Category:Rosids of Western Australia Category:Vulnerable flora of Australia Category:Plants described in 2001 Category:Taxa named by Barbara Lynette Rye Category:Taxa named by Malcolm Eric Trudgen
title: Thryptomene striata
